business.headline: Paytm shares cross Rs 700 for the first time since January. More room to rise?	Before today, the last time Paytm traded above Rs 700 was in late January, closing at Rs 761.

Radhika Gupta calls SIPs the new status symbol for Delhi's young investorsRadhika Gupta, MD and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, believes that the true indicator of success in today's financial landscape should be how much one invests in Systematic Investment Plans (SIPs), not the number of real estate holdings.

Government assures no price hikes for essential commodities this festive seasonThe Ministry of Food and Consumer Affairs has highlighted that, as of now, there are no plans to allow any increase in prices for essentials items.
Bajaj Housing Finance shares dip after multibagger rally: Buy, hold, or sell?After a stellar market debut, Bajaj Housing Finance shares have dipped today—should investors be concerned or hold steady?

How West Bengal lost its crown as India's financial hubFrom economic powerhouse to struggling state, West Bengal's fall from its prime spot in India's financial scene tells a story of lost opportunity and shifting fortunes.

How lower US Fed rates can affect IT sector: Key stocks to watchHistorically, a Fed rate cut cycle has often signalled the end of a period of high demand for IT services exports, leading to an economic slowdown.
Sensex, Nifty hit all-time high after early dip; Ola Electric shares up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 188.33 points to 83,267.99, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 46.90 points to 25,465.45
SpiceJet yet to pay Rs 350 crore in TDS, PF of employeesSpiceJet has not paid Rs 220 crore in TDS deductions from employees' salaries between April 2020 and August 2023 to tax authorities.

India's richest and poorest states: South leads GDP race, West Bengal stumblesWhile the southern states have emerged as major contributors to India's GDP, states like West Bengal, once economically strong, have witnessed a puzzling decline, according to a working paper released by the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister.

NPS Vatsalya to be introduced today: Check scheme details, benefits and moreThe scheme, announced during the Budget in July 2024, is designed for parents and guardians to make long-term investments for their minor children.

Centre asks edible oil industry to maintain prices amid duty hike on importsThe leading edible oil associations were advised to ensure that the MRP of each type of oil is maintained until stocks imported at 0% and 12.5% BCD are exhausted.

Sensex, Nifty open flat ahead of US Fed's rate decision; Bajaj Finance jumps The S&P BSE Sensex was up 27.55 points to 83,107.21 at 10:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 0.90 points to trade at 25,419.65.

Gold, silver price today, September 18, 2024: Yellow metal trades higher, silver records dip on MCXGold Price Today 18 September 2024: Gold is trading on the higher side while silver rates have recorded a dip on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Wednesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

UK's Guardian in talks to sell Observer newspaper to Tortoise Media: ReportTortoise said negotiations include a commitment from it to invest more than 25 million pounds ($33 million) over the next five years in the editorial and commercial renewal of the title.

Smriti Irani discusses gender parity with World Bank leaders, highlights India's progressDuring her meeting in Washington, Smriti Irani highlighted the need for effective implementation of gender equity policies to ensure that women, especially in developing regions, can contribute to both government and industry while realising their full potential.

Sensex, Nifty rise ahead of US Fed rate decision; Ola Electric shares surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 90.88 points at 83,079.66 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 34.80 points to settle at 25,418.55.

Zerodha to bring 'Alert Trigger Orders' on Kite mobile: What you need to knowUnlike standard alerts that only notify traders when certain market conditions are met, ATOs take it a step further by automatically executing a basket of orders.

Bajaj Housing Finance shares rally 160% post-IPO: Book profits or hold?Bajaj Housing Finance share price: On Tuesday, the stock hit its 10% upper circuit at Rs 181.50 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), continuing its upward trajectory.
Will US Fed cut rates by 25 bps or 50 bps? Here's all you need to knowA 25 bps rate cut could calm markets, but a deeper one may raise economic alarm.

US Fed likely to cut key rates this week. Why is it a big deal?The US central bank is likely to cut interest rates for the first time in more than four years, with experts predicting a 0.25 percentage point reduction.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: One Nation One Election cleared by Cabinet, bill in winter session likelyOne Nation One Election: The bill for holding simultaneous polls is likely to be introduced in the upcoming winter session of Parliament, sources said.
Chandrayaan-4 gets Cabinet nod to go to Moon and return with lunar soil, rocksChandrayaan-4 gets Cabinet nod to go to Moon and return with lunar soil, rocks

How thousands of pagers were rigged, exploded: Decoded in 3 easy pointsThere was a possible supply chain poisoning in Europe whereby a tiny amount of explosive PETN was placed in around 5,000 pagers. They were remotely detonated in a synchronised attack. Here's the whole operation explained in three easy points.

A mother's powerful letter to EY India on 'work culture' after daughter's deathAnna Sebastian Perayil, a 26-year-old chartered accountant from Kerala, joined Ernst & Young in March. Her mother blamed "four months of EY's callous attitude" for her death.

From Pappu Pager to Pushpa, how India had a blast with pagersPagers, which connected the landline era to the cellphone age, were a blip in India's technology radar in the 90s. However, Bollywood had a blast with pagers, right from Satish Kaushik AKA Pappu Pager to Faizal Khan of Gangs of Wassepur and Allu Arjun of Pushpa.
Cabinet clears Venus Orbiter Mission, Isro to explore Earth's mysterious twinThe mission, with a budget of Rs. 1,236 crore (approximately $149 million), is scheduled for launch in March 2028.
Video: Canadian MP Jagmeet Singh confronts protesters after being heckledNDP leader Jagmeet Singh confronted protesters outside the Canadian Parliament after someone accused him of being corrupted.

Congress holds protests against Ravneet Bittu's 'terrorist' jab at Rahul GandhiCongress leader Ajay Maken filed a complaint against BJP leaders and Ravneet Bittu over open threats to 'eliminate' or cause physical injury to Rahul Gandhi.

J&K polls: Others threaten prospects of legacy parties, could force hung AssemblyEngineer Rashid's victory over Omar Abdullah in the Lok Sabha polls, the defeat of Mehbooba Mufti, and the general weakening of the PDP have scared legacy parties in Jammu and Kashmir, who now accuse the BJP of using proxies.

Supply chain attack turned pagers into killer devices in Lebanon?Lebanon pager explosions: What led to the pagers in Lebanon, which became obsolete in the early 2000s, to explode? Experts have called it a prime example of a supply chain attack.

Trump says India abuser of import tariffs, calls PM Modi fantastic ahead of meetFormer US President Donald Trump stated that he will be meeting with PM Modi next week during his three-day visit to the US.

3 dead as portion of building collapses in Delhi's Karol Bagh, 12 rescuedSearch and rescue operations are being carried out by the Delhi Fire Service, police and personnel from the National Disaster Response Force.
Caught by Taliban, iron ore train ride: Why travellers love extreme travelFrom swimming with sharks to exploring remote parts of the Earth, experts have noted a clear rise in extreme travel.

Israel briefed US on pager blasts targeting Hezbollah after operation: ReportThe United States, initially, said it did not have any prior information on the Lebanon pager blasts and washed its hands of the incident.

EY India employee's death exposes hidden costs of hustle cultureA 26-year-old chartered accountant's death due to "excessive workload" has highlighted the devastating effects of hustle culture on our health and mental well-being.

Kolkata cops assaulted, threatened by mob at checkpost; one arrestedThe mob broke the officers' bikes and threatened to set them ablaze. A case against the accused was filed at the Topsia Police Station.

Video: UP cop sits on train track to end life, accuses judge of humiliating himThe police officer alleged that the judge repeatedly scolded him. Hurt by the accusations and threats, he went to the railway track to end his life.

You would know better: Gautam Gambhir's quip cracks up Virat KohliGautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli showed their light-hearted side as the Indian coach had a cheeky response to the star batter's question about how he managed his on-field chatter with the opposition.

How politics, like Bollywood, restricts entry of outsidersIf there's any profession that can match Bollywood in restricting smooth entry of outsiders, it is politics. Even as Iltija Mufti, daughter of former J&K Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti, makes her electoral debut, here's a study that reveals how 32% of MPs in the current Lok Sabha are political dynasts. Shah Rukh Khans are rare.

How West Bengal lost its crown as India's financial hubFrom economic powerhouse to struggling state, West Bengal's fall from its prime spot in India's financial scene tells a story of lost opportunity and shifting fortunes.

Rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs's home raided: 1,000 bottles of baby oil seizedLegal documents have surfaced detailing serious allegations against Sean 'Diddy' Combs. The indictment stated that 1,000 bottles of baby oil were found in his home and it also accused him of maintaining a system of coercion, abuse, and violence.

J&K Assembly polls largely peaceful, Pulwama records lowest voter turnout Live UpdatesThe first phase of the Jammu and Kashmir Assembly elections on Wednesday saw 24 constituencies across seven districts voting for the first time in 10 years.

Caste census, women empowerment: Congress's poll guarantees to HaryanaThe Congress has so far released four candidates' lists for Haryana Assembly elections slated to take place on October 5, taking the total number of contenders to 86.

Serbian man 'accidentally' enters a bear's den, video of his narrow escape is viralA Serbian influencer had a heart-stopping encounter when he 'accidentally' wandered into a bear's den. The animal returned to its den and sniffed him before he made a narrow escape.
Harry Potter actor Katie Leung to play negative role in Bridgerton 4Katie Leung, known for her role as Cho Chang in Harry Potter, will play the antagonist Lady Araminta Gun in Bridgerton Season 4.

Urmila Matondkar wishes Shabana Azmi on 74th birthday: The Maa that CineMa gave meVeteran actor Shabana Azmi turns 74 today, September 18. On the special occasion, Urmila Matondkar shared a sweet note for the actor on social media  referring to her as the 'Maa that CineMa' gave her.

15 years of Wanted: Boney Kapoor shares how he convinced Salman Khan for the filmToday marks the 15th anniversary of Salman Khan's blockbuster film Wanted. In an old interview, the film's producer, Boney Kapoor, revealed how he visited the superstar at midnight to convince him to take on the role.
BTS Jin leaves for Milan Fashion Week, shares note for fansBTS member Jin has left for Milan to attend its fashion week. The artiste shared a note as he got ready for his flight.

sports.headline: Virat Kohli's training reflects his hunger to be best in world: Gautam GambhirGautam Gambhir hailed Virat Kohli's ongoing hunger to be the best in the world. The star batter will be back in red-ball action for the two-match Test series against Bangladesh.

Learn and adapt, there's no one style of playing Test cricket: Gautam GambhirIndia vs Bangladesh: Speaking to the press on the eve of the first Test in Chennai, head coach Gautam Gambhir opened up about his style of coaching the Test team, the workload management issues and their road to the World Test Championship final.

Liam Livingstone becomes ICC's No.1 ranked T20I all-rounder after heroics vs AUSLiam Livingstone's explosive all-round performance has propelled him to the top of the ICC Men's T20I all-rounder rankings. His consistent heroics with both bat and ball in the series against Australia secured him Player of the Series honours.

Rohit Sharma firm on T20I decision: 'Retirement has become a joke in cricket'Rohit Sharma ruled out any chance of returning to T20I cricket, stating that his decision to retire from the format after the T20 World Cup triumph is final. However, he continues to play in both ODI and Test cricket.

India is a batting-obsessed nation but Bumrah, Ashwin changing trend: GambhirIndia coach Gautam Gambhir has highlighted the pivotal role of bowlers like Jasprit Bumrah, Ravichandran Ashwin, and Ravindra Jadeja in changing the nation's cricket focus from batting to bowling. Speaking before the first Test against Bangladesh, Gambhir praised their world-class skills and impact on Indian cricket.

Serie A: AS Roma sack legend Danielle de Rossi as coach after winless startAS Roma have decided to sack legend Danielle de Rossi as the head coach of the club following their winless start to the 2024-25 campaign.

Gautam Gambhir blasts pitch critics questioning Test lasting 3 days in IndiaGautam Gambhir blasted pitch critics who question a Test match lasting only three days in India. A spin-friendly track is expected at Chepauk during 1st Test between India and Bangladesh.

India respect everyone, won't fear anyone: Gautam GambhirIndia vs Bangladesh: Speaking to the press on the eve of the first Test in Chennai, head coach Gautam Gambhir said India won't take Bangladesh lightly in the two-match series. Bangladesh are heading into the series, high on confidence after having won 2-0 in Pakistan earlier in September.

Gautam Gambhir hails Virat Kohli as India's best Test captain: Credit goes to youGautam Gambhir hailed Virat Kohli as the best Test captain of the country. He credited Kohli for building a formidable unit of fast bowlers who could take 20 wickets and make India win the Test in overseas conditions.

'Phenomenal' Rishabh Pant's batting overshadows his keeping: Gautam GambhirGautam Gambhir heaped praise on 'phenomenal' Rishabh Pant and claimed that his batting does overshadow his wicketkeeping skills at times.

Gambhir confirms Rahul, Pant to start ahead of Sarfaraz, Jurel in 1st TestIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir has all but confirmed that experienced cricketers KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant will play in the first Test against Bangladesh ahead of young talents Sarfaraz Khan and Dhruv Jurel.

'Superstar' Shubman Gill should be next India T20I captain: Suresh RainaSuresh Raina claimed that Shubman Gill should be next in line to become the India T20I captain and hailed the young batter as a superstar.

When Virat Kohli chanted Om Namah Shivay during dream run in Australia TestsIndia head coach, during his freewheeling chat with Virat Kohli, revealed that the superstar batter kept chanting 'Om Namah Shivay' mantra throughout the tour of Australia in 2014-15. Gambhir and Kohli spoke about the importance of concentration in Test cricket.

Do you eat soaked almonds? Virat Kohli tells Gautam Gambhir to ask Rohit SharmaVirat Kohli told India coach Gautam Gambhir to ask a hilarious question to Rohit Sharma when he gets to interview the captain next time. Kohli and Gambhir interacted in a fine interview which was released by the BCCI on September 18, Wednesday.

'Golden girl' Manu Bhaker eyes hitting bullseye at Los Angeles OlympicsManu Bhaker has claimed that her aim at the Los Angeles Olympics would be to ensure that she would change the colour of her medal from bronze to gold. Manu was one of the stars for India in the Paris Olympics.

Champions Trophy: ICC delegation to review security arrangements in PakistanA five-member ICC delegation visited Pakistan to inspect venues for the 2024 Champions Trophy. Discussions included the tentative schedule and the possibility of the Indian team playing in Lahore.

Endrick has the gift that strikers dreams of: Real Madrid boss Carlo AncelottiReal Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti was in awe of Endrick after the Brazilian forward's incredible goal against Stuttgart in the Champions League on September 17, Tuesday. Endrick's goal helped Los Blancos seal a win on Tuesday.

Watch: Kohli interviews Gambhir, puts end to 'masala' in crackling chatWatch: Star batter Virat Kohli and head coach Gautam Gambhir sat down for an engaging interview, putting an end to years of rumors about the reported tension between the two.

Adam Zampa accepts slim Ashes hopes as milestone 100th ODI nearsEngland vs Australia: Star leg-spinner Adam Zampa acknowledged that he might never play in an Ashes Test match as he prepares for his milestone 100th one-day international (ODI).

Indian players will enjoy coach Gambhir's aggression: Dinesh KarthikFormer India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik on Tuesday said head coach Gautam Gambhir's display of aggression in the past has generally come out in "protection of his players".

Saqib Mahmood added to England squad for ODI series vs AustraliaEngland vs Australia: The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) added right-arm pacer Saqib Mahmood to their squad for the five-match ODI series against Australia.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
